Name: Vase decorated with crocodiles
Description: This beautiful elongated vase is characterised by a round neck under which many wavy lines are painted. The belly is decorated, from top to bottom, by a row of triangles, a second row of ox-heads and four crocodiles of whom the bodies are covered by undulations representing the scales. The receptacle, which seems to come from Gebelein, dates from the Naqada II Period.
